oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nat Winston recordings - Harvey Gragg's house - 1963-08-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recordings of various folk songs recorded by Nat Winston at Harvey Gragg's house on August 17, 1963 featuring performers Floyd Gragg, Shirley Simmons, Obie Garrett, Clayton Gragg, David Gragg, Harvey Gragg, Mrs. Harvey Gragg, Linda Gragg and Edward Gragg according to Nat Winston on recording and Tennessee State Library and Archives.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Floyd Gragg; Shirley Simmons; Obie Garrett; Clayton Gragg; David Gragg; Harvey Gragg; Mrs. Harvey Gragg; Linda Gragg; Edward Gragg
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Nat Winston introduction -- Cripple Creek (various) -- Old Joe Clark (various) -- Sally Goodin (various) -- Saddle Up The Mule (various) [unconfirmed] -- Walking In The Parlor (various) -- Shout Little Lulie (various) -- Mountain Talk (various) [unconfirmed] -- The Johnson Boys (various) -- Whoa Mule Whoa (various) -- Cotton-Eyed Joe (various) -- Banks Of The Ohio (various) -- Sourwood Mountain (various) -- Careless Love (various) -- Liberty (various) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (various) -- Little Maggie (various) -- Darlin' Cory (various) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (various) -- Bury Me Beneath The Willow (various) -- Wait A Little Longer Please Jesus (various) -- As Long As I Live (various) -- Listen To The Mockingbird (various) [unconfirmed] -- Nat Winston introduces each performer
